metadata.key_specifications: 512-Kb I2C EEPROM, 128-byte page write buffer, Standard/Fast/Fast-Plus I2C protocol, ECC, 1.8V to 5.5V operation, -40°C to +125°C temperature range, 1M program/erase cycles endurance, 100 years data retention
metadata.applications: The on-chip ECC makes the device suitable for high reliability applications.

page_summaries.content: The CAT24C512 is a EERPOM Serial 512 −Kb I 2C internally organized as 65,536 words of 8 bits each. It features a 128−byte page write buffer and supports the Standard (100 kHz), Fast (400 kHz) and Fast−Plus (1 MHz) I2C protocol. Write operations can be inhibited by taking the WP pin High (this protects the entire memory). External address pins make it possible to address up to eight CAT24C512 devices on the same bus. On−Chip ECC (Error Correction Code) makes the device suitable for high reliability applications.

Table 3. D.C. OPERATING CHARACTERISTICS 
VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +85°C and VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +125°C, unless otherwise speciﬁed.

Table 4. PIN IMPEDANCE CHARACTERISTICS
VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +85°C and VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +125°C, unless otherwise speciﬁed.

Table 2. RELIABILITY CHARACTERISTICS (Note 2)
NEND (Notes 3, 4) Endurance 1,000,000 Program/Erase Cycles
TDR Data Retention 100 Years

Table 5. A.C. CHARACTERISTICS (Note 7)
VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +85°C and VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +125°C, unless otherwise specified.

[Table with A.C. characteristics parameters and values]

Table 6. A.C. TEST CONDITIONS
Input Levels 0.2 x VCC to 0.8 x VCC
Input Rise and Fall Times ≤ 50 ns
Input Reference Levels 0.3 x VCC, 0.7 x VCC
Output Reference Levels 0.5 x VCC
Output Load Current Source: IL = 3 mA (VCC ≥ 2.5 V); IL = 1 mA (VCC < 2.5 V); CL = 100 pF

Power-On Reset (POR)
The CAT24C512 incorporates Power −On Reset (POR) circuitry which protects the internal logic against powering up in the wrong state.

[Description of POR behavior]

Pin Description
SCL: The Serial Clock input pin accepts the Serial Clock signal generated by the Master.
SDA: The Serial Data I/O pin receives input data and transmits data stored in EEPROM. In transmit mode, this pin is open drain. Data is acquired on the positive edge, and is delivered on the negative edge of SCL.
A0, A1 and A2: The Address pins accept the device address. These pins have on−chip pull−down resistors.
WP: The Write Protect input pin inhibits all write operations, when pulled HIGH. This pin has an on −chip pull−down resistor.

Functional Description
[Description of I2C bus protocol, device addressing, acknowledge, etc.]
[Figures illustrating START/STOP condition timing, slave address bits, acknowledge timing, bus timing]

Product Summary.content: The CAT24C512 is a EERPOM Serial 512 −Kb I2C memory chip internally organized as 65,536 words of 8 bits each. It features a 128−byte page write buffer and supports the Standard (100 kHz), Fast (400 kHz) and Fast−Plus (1 MHz) I2C protocol.

The CAT24C512 supports write protection by taking the WP pin High, which protects the entire memory from being overwritten. It also features external address pins that allow up to eight CAT24C512 devices to be addressed on the same I2C bus.
The on-chip Error Correction Code (ECC) feature of the CAT24C512 makes it suitable for high reliability applications, ensuring data integrity and robustness.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Table 3 provides D.C. operating characteristics for the device, including voltage and temperature ranges. Table 4 specifies pin impedance characteristics under the same conditions. These tables cover important electrical parameters for proper operation of the device.

Table 2 lists reliability characteristics, such as endurance for program/erase cycles and data retention time. Table 5 provides A.C. characteristics, including timing parameters, while Table 6 specifies the test conditions for measuring these A.C. characteristics, such as input/output levels, rise/fall times, and load conditions.

The device incorporates Power-On Reset (POR) circuitry to protect the internal logic during power-up. This section describes the behavior of the POR circuit. The pin descriptions cover the functions of the serial clock (SCL), serial data (SDA), address (A0-A2), and write protect (WP) pins.

The functional description section covers the I2C bus protocol, device addressing scheme, acknowledge mechanism, and provides timing diagrams illustrating START/STOP conditions, slave address bits, acknowledge timing, and overall bus timing. These details are crucial for proper communication with the device over the I2C interface.

It includes details about the package type, size, case number, issue number, date, and various mechanical specifications such as dimensions and tolerances for the body, leads, and other features.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: Table 3. D.C. OPERATING CHARACTERISTICS VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +85°C and VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +125°C, unless otherwise speciﬁed.
Table 4. PIN IMPEDANCE CHARACTERISTICS VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +85°C and VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V, TA = −40°C to +125°C, unless otherwise speciﬁed.
Table 2. RELIABILITY CHARACTERISTICS (Note 2) NEND (Notes 3, 4) Endurance 1,000,000 Program/Erase Cycles TDR Data Retention 100 Years
Operating temperature ranges: -40°C to +85°C for VCC = 1.8 V to 5.5 V, and -40°C to +125°C for VCC = 2.5 V to 5.5 V.
Reliability tests: 1,000,000 Program/Erase Cycles endurance and 100 Years data retention.
